stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.

stadium.name: The Su'akour Bowl
stadium.description: A crude, rowdy stadium built within the half-finished, black-stone walls of the warlord Su'akour's abandoned fortress. The stands are crumbling ruins, and the entire arena perpetually stinks of the nearby sulfur marshes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Kissing their biceps and whispering words of encouragement to them.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Washing their hands with dirt.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Asking the referee to bless their weapon.
Finding the muddiest puddle and stomping in it with bare feet.
Staring at a single blade of grass until their eyes water.
Wiping a teammate's sweat onto their own forehead.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.

preGame:
üèüÔ∏è WELCOME TO THE MAIN EVENT, SPORTS FANS! Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live from the Prismatic Pavilion! The air is thick with the scent of lagoon water and the palpable desperation of two teams on the brink! This is the big one, folks‚Äîthe tie-breaking Game Three of this Best of 3 playoff series! The winner moves on, and the loser gets a one-way ticket to the loser's bracket! Can you feel the electricity? Or is that just the unstable footing on these creaky stage-planks? 

Would you look at the focus on these warriors? I see Bollinger Susette over there for the Fire Eaters, getting his teammate to punch him in the shoulder‚Äînow that's a pre-game ritual I can get behind! Give him another one for luck! And look at Nachison Icken, bless her dark heart, she's got her boots on the wrong feet again! She's ready to dance a bloody jig all over this field! On the other side, Quintessa Austine is trying to start a slow clap with the crowd. It‚Äôs a bit pathetic since nobody is joining in, but I admire the theatricality! 

Neither of these teams has much of a following today‚Äîit seems the fans are too busy worshipping the likes of Sir Artorias or that fancy-bow-wielding Sir Randy to witness a real massacre! Their loss! More room for us to watch the carnage as the Prismatic Troupe performers swirl around the field! Let's see if the Brimstone Fire Eaters can handle the lagoon splash, or if the Bizarres will send them sinking into the depths of the loser's bracket! üèà‚ú®
postGame:
# üé≠ A PRISMATIC PULP-MAKING! THE BIZARRES ASCEND! 

Great galloping ghouls, what a beautiful, one-sided slaughter! If you were looking for a close contest, you were in the wrong reality! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres didn't just win Game Three; they performed a total vivisection on the Brimstone Fire Eaters, winning 9 to 0! I haven't seen this much disappointment in a single stadium since I saw Sir Tanos trying to read a 'Keep Out' sign! The Bizarres take the series 2-1 and march forward, while the Fire Eaters are left to lick their wounds in the loser's bracket! 

The Bizarres started the fire early! Aggri Cookie, after staring at his gauntlets like they held the meaning of life, stepped up in Center Field and hammered home a 2-point shoot! The troll head zipped through the air faster than a warlock fleeing a bad contract! It was a masterpiece of precision that silenced the few Fire Eater fans who actually bothered to show up! 

But wait, the violence! We love it! The first half was a meat grinder. Campball Fink took a heavy hit from Demp Chet and went down early, looking like a discarded rag doll. But the healers in this Everwar are miracle workers‚Äîeven if they can't heal the absolute shame of a 9-point blowout! It was a symphony of crunching bones that had the Prismatic Troupe performers cheering from the sidelines! 

Aggri Cookie was a monster tonight! Not content with just scoring, he went on a tackling spree that would make Cyfnerth the Butcher weep with joy! He leveled Campball Fink again and then flattened Selimah Tully right after! It was like watching a professional butcher in a high-speed chase‚Äîjust absolute efficiency in delivering pain! 

The Fire Eaters tried to respond, they really did. Orlina Jerrine snagged a beautiful interception off a wild pass, but the Brimstone offense was more unstable than the footing on these lagoon stilts! Lowson Hersh‚Äôs shot went wider than Lord Orzalon‚Äôs temper! You simply cannot win if you can't hit the goal, even if the referee is blessing your daggers! 

Halftime came and went, and whatever Raphael Miyasawa whispered to her biceps, it didn't help! The second half was a non-stop barrage of Bizarres' scoring. Pompei Hephzipa, after performing some truly aggressive theatrical poses, took a pass in the End Zone and dunked the ball right into the goal! That's how you put on a show for the Starlight Lagoon! 

Then the shoots started raining down like cursed hail! Demp Chet from Center Field‚ÄîBOOM! Two points! Quintessa Austine, finally finished with his failed slow clap, steps up and hits another! Two more points! The Fire Eaters looked like they were standing still, probably because Nachison Icken was still trying to figure out why her boots felt so strange! 

Melesa Zelten decided to join the festivities, firing another 2-point rocket from Center Field! The Brimstone defense was more porous than a sponge at the bottom of the lagoon! I bet even Sir Randy and his fancy bow couldn't have hit those shots under the pressure of a playoff finale! The Bizarres were playing with their food at this point! 

Let's talk about the delicious injuries! Poor Kristin Kronfeld took a beating from Nachison Icken, and Bollinger Susette got pancaked by Bush Heiner later on. It was a glorious display of athletic brutality that makes me proud to call Trollball my favorite sport! The blood on the stage-planks was the most colorful thing in the Pavilion tonight! 

Late in the game, Nigel Rothmuller threw a pass so wild it looked like he was trying to communicate with a bird in the rafters, and Willa Lois picked it off like a ripe plum. That interception put the final nail in the Fire Eaters' coffin! They were completely demoralized, overwhelmed by the lagoon splashes and the relentless assault of the Starlight Shooters! 

So, there you have it! The series ends 2-1 in favor of the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres! They move on in the playoffs, while the Brimstone Fire Eaters head to the loser's bracket to rethink their weather-rhyming strategies. I hope Morgwae and Artorias were watching, because this is what real victory looks like‚Äîtotal, crushing dominance! Final Score: The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres 9 - The Brimstone Fire Eaters 0! Goodnight, Osterra, and keep your heads on your shoulders‚Äîunless someone decides to kick them into a basket! üéáüíÄ
